description.para: Calls the AWS Network Manager DescribeGlobalNetworks API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2020 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para:
Describes one or more global networks. By default, all global networks are described. To describe the objects in your global network, you must use the appropriate Get* action. For example, to list the transit gateways in your global network, use GetTransitGatewayRegistrations.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.
The IDs of one or more global networks. The maximum is 10.
The maximum number of results to return.

The token for the next page of results.
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'GlobalNetworks'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.NetworkManager.Model.DescribeGlobalNetworksResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.NetworkManager.Model.DescribeGlobalNetworksResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.
The IDs of one or more global networks. The maximum is 10.
The maximum number of results to return.

The token for the next page of results.
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'GlobalNetworks'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.NetworkManager.Model.DescribeGlobalNetworksResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.NetworkManager.Model.DescribeGlobalNetworksResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

This cmdlet returns a collection of Amazon.NetworkManager.Model.GlobalNetwork objects. The service call response (type Amazon.NetworkManager.Model.DescribeGlobalNetworksResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.

description.para: Registers a transit gateway in your global network. The transit gateway can be in any AWS Region, but it must be owned by the same AWS account that owns the global network. You cannot register a transit gateway in more than one global network.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the transit gateway. For more information, see Resources Defined by Amazon EC2.
The ID of the global network.

description.para:
Gets the association information for customer gateways that are associated with devices and links in your global network.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2020 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: Associates a customer gateway with a device and optionally, with a link. If you specify a link, it must be associated with the specified device. You can only associate customer gateways that are connected to a VPN attachment on a transit gateway. The transit gateway must be registered in your global network. When you register a transit gateway, customer gateways that are connected to the transit gateway are automatically included in the global network. To list customer gateways that are connected to a transit gateway, use the DescribeVpnConnections EC2 API and filter by transit-gateway-id. You cannot associate a customer gateway with more than one device and link.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the customer gateway. For more information, see Resources Defined by Amazon EC2.
The ID of the global network.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'CustomerGatewayAssociation'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.NetworkManager.Model.AssociateCustomerGatewayResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.NetworkManager.Model.AssociateCustomerGatewayResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the CustomerGatewayArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^CustomerGatewayArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the customer gateway. For more information, see Resources Defined by Amazon EC2.

Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.NetworkManager.Model.UpdateLinkResponse).
